    • crossProduct

      public static double crossProduct(double x1, double y1, double x2, double y2)
            determine the cross product and return negative number if the 2nd
      set of values, p1, are clockwise from the first, p1, w.r.t. origin (0,0).
      
 P2
          .
          .
          .   * P1      <--- P2 is counterclockwise from P1 w.r.t. origin o
          .
          o
      
 P2
                .
        P1 *    .       <--- P2 is clockwise from P1 w.r.t. origin o
                .
                .
                o
      Parameters:
      x1 -
      y1 -
      x2 -
      y2 -
      Returns:

    • linesIntersect

      public static boolean linesIntersect(int x1, int y1, int x2, int y2, int x3, int y3, int x4, int y4)
      from pseudocode in "Introduction to Algorithms" by Cormen et al. runtime complexity is O(N lg N) where N is the number of line segments. worse case runtime complexity is O(N^2).
      Parameters:
      x1 -
      y1 -
      x2 -
      y2 -
      x3 -
      y3 -
      x4 -
      y4 -
      Returns:

    • crossProduct

      public static int crossProduct(int x1, int y1, int x2, int y2)
      determine the cross product and return negative number if the 2nd set of values, p1, are clockwise from the first, p1, w.r.t. origin (0,0). 
                o P2
          .
          .
          .   o P1       P2 is counterclockwise from P1
          .
          0
     ---------------------------------------------------------
                o P2
                .
        P1 o    .        P2 is clockwise from P1
                .
                .
                0
      Parameters:
      x1 -
      y1 -
      x2 -
      y2 -
      Returns:

    • calcClockwiseAngle

      public static double calcClockwiseAngle(int x1, int y1, int x2, int y2, int x3, int y3)
      Calculate the angle of segment P3:P1 sweeping clockwise to segment P3:P2. Internally, the method uses the law of cosines and the direction method. 
         P1     P2
 
      P3
      NOTE that if given a single point, it will return NaN
      Parameters:
      x1 -
      y1 -
      x2 -
      y2 -
      x3 -
      y3 -
      Returns:
